title: An Ancient Practice Transformed by the Arrival of Europeans
text: Long before Christopher Columbus sailed to the New World, various forms of slavery flourished in Europe and Africa. But these Old World practices differed in important ways from the types of slavery that developed in the Americas after the institution of the Atlantic slave trade in the 1500s. New World slavery was a racialized institution in which slaves were black and slave owners were white. In contrast, owners and slaves in the Old World were generally of the same race.
